listitems.title: Understand Loaders
listitems.content: ...communicate how loaders 'fit' into a frontend build system

listitems.title: Include some loaders into a frontend boilerpalte setup
listitems.content: ...know which loaders to user here and install them in this frontend build system

listitems.title: Why loaders
listitems.content: Loaders are used by webpack to do several tasks - convert files to browser readable code, bundle files, images, stylesheets, and more for client-ready consumption, and more. Here's a list of loaders, a brief description of each, and a single install script at the end.

listitems.title: @babel/preset-react
listitems.content: includes a few other plugins that transform react's jsx syntax to brwoser-readable js

listitems.title: babel-loader
listitems.content: transforms 'modern' javascript that may not be readable by browsers and makes the js readable

listitems.title: css-loader
listitems.content: converts js 'import' syntax on css files for browsers

listitems.title: html-webpack=plugin
listitems.content: we'll tell this plugin to use our html template for the html root of our project

listitems.title: html-loader
listitems.content: we'll use this to minify our template html file

listitems.title: sass-loader
listitems.content: loads && convers sass files to css files

listitems.title: install script
listitems.content: npm i @babel/preset-react@7.12.13 babel-loader@8.2.2 css-loader@5.0.2 html-loader@2.0.0 html-webpack-plugin@5.1.0 sass-loader@11.0.1 style-loader@2.0.0
